intro: Psychotria guadalupensis subsp. grosourdieana, commonly known as the Mexican psychotria, is a species native to Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. This plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. The plant is often found in shaded, humid environments within tropical and subtropical regions.
